metadata.title: CVE-2017-9993 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
FFmpeg before 2.8.12, 3.0.x and 3.1.x before 3.1.9, 3.2.x before 3.2.6, and3.3.x before 3.3.2 does not properly restrict HTTP Live Streaming filenameextensions and demuxer names, which allows attackers to read arbitraryfiles via crafted playlist data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9993` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.2.6-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.2.6-1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavcodec58 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavdevice58 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.2.6-1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavfilter7 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavformat58 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavresample4 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavutil56 - 7:3.2.6-1
libpostproc55 - 7:3.2.6-1
libswresample3 - 7:3.2.6-1
libswscale5 - 7:3.2.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.2.6-1').
